resources:
Red Blue Green White Black
BurnIn Tester Testing Colour Next Colour Start Testing Welcome to the early burn-in tester by ptgms! Finish Test The Results are here! Exit tester Flawless Burned In Select \"Burned In\" if your screen had marks and \"Flawless\" if it didn\'t. \nSee notes below for how to tell if burn-ins exist How to tell if your display has burn-ins: The Display will light up with colours in the test, see if your display has any marks in it while displaying a colour. If it does, your screen is having a burn-in. A burn-in cannot be fixed with software methods, all you can do is replace the screen. Display Resolution: Display Density: Aspect Ratio: Display Type: What to do now? Crash App To Results Debug Mode Toggle Debug Mode in Release Build You cannot fix this issue with any App or Software mod, all you can do is replace your entire screen unit. This may not be worth it. Please look up the price of a screen for your phone and decide for yourself if it\'s an worthwhile expense. You marked your screen as working! You marked your screen as having Burn-In marks, yikes!> You have your dark mode enabled. Please make sure if you\'re using Android Q or later that you\'re not forcing System-Wide dark mode. Warning! I understand, let me in! Let me change the setting! PLACEHOLDER Warning! Dismiss Fix You\'re running debug Mode! You will have certain debug features enabled, beware of bugs! Clear all Make sure your brightness is set to maximum. You enabled Debug Mode!
